item.title: Preorders Are Now Live For The Upcoming Minecraft-Inspired Pokemon Spinoff, Pokemon Pokopia
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

A new Pokemon game is out next year for Switch 2, and it looks like a wild spin-off from your typical "gotta-catch-'em-all" experience. Pokemon Pokopia is an open-world game where players build a utopia for wild pocket monsters. The game launches on March 5, 2026. and preoders are available now for $70 at Amazon, Walmart, and several other retailers. Players who preorder the game will also receive an in-game Ditto rug for their Pokopia world.

Pokemon Pokopia (Switch 2)

$70 | Releases March 5, 2026

First revealed in September 2025, Pokemon Pokopia is set in a world where humanity has vanished and looks inspired by games like Minecraft, Animal Crossing, and Dragon Quest Builders. One peculiar Ditto returns to find the land withered, and its only remaining resident is a Tangrowth, known simply as Professor Tangrwoth. Using its transformation powers to pass itself off as a human, the Ditto works to restore the land and inspire other Pokemon to return.

Players won't just be limited to one island, as the Ditto can transform into a Lapras or Dragonite to reach new locations. Crafting also plays a big role in Pokemon Pokopia, as collected materials can be fashioned into tools and infrastructure to improve buildings and complete quests.

Pokemon Pokopia will be the first Nintendo-published game for Switch 2 to be released as a Game Key Card. This means the physical cartridge will serve as an authentication device, and you'll still need to download the full game to your console. It is worth noting that Game Key Cards are not tied to your console, so you can resell them in the future if you choose to. The game will take up roughly 10GBs of space--so if you're planning to buy the game, you'll want to consider picking up a microSD Express card to increase your storage capacity. Luckily, Amazon currently has a great deal on the Samsung P9 512GB card. Normally $100, this is on sale for $75 while stocks last.

Amazon has also restocked the Switch 2 Mario Kart bundle and is matching Walmart's deal price of $449 (was $500), in case you're looking to get a Switch 2 for the festive season. For more Switch 2 deals, you can also check out our buying guide for Metroid Prime 4: Beyond to see the best prices on the highly anticipated game, related merchandise, and Amiibo figures.

item.title: Where To Preorder Monster Hunter Stories 3
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The third entry in Capcom's turn-based RPG spinoff of the Monster Hunter series, Monster Hunter Stories 3: Twisted Reflection, launches on Switch 2, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, and PC on March 13, 2026. Preorders for the game are now live, including the physical edition on consoles. PC players can also save nearly 20% on preorders for digital versions of the game at Fanatical. All versions of the game come with a special preorder bonus. Check out full details on the game, preorder bonuses, and more below.

Monster Hunter Stories 3: Twisted Reflection Preorder Bonus

Preordering any version of Monster Hunter 3: Twisted Reflection gets you Skyscale Queen Layered Armor for the playable character Eleanor. The armor is based on the iconic Rathalos set that fans of the mainline Monster Hunter games will recognize. Layered armor is purely cosmetic--it doesn't confer any stat bonuses or abilities, unlike other gear in the game, but it will at least let you represent one of the series' flagship creatures regardless of the other gear you're wearing.

All physical and digital preorders include this bonus.

Monster Hunter Stories 3: Twisted Reflection

$70 | Releases March 13, 2026

The standard edition for Monster Hunter Stories 3: Twisted Reflection includes the full base game on your platform of choice, plus the Skyscale Queen Layered Armor if you preorder ahead of launch. Physical PS5, Switch 2, and Xbox Series X versions are available at Amazon and GameStop. Digital preorders are also available.

Note that the Switch 2 version is a Game Key-Card release. This means none of the game data is stored on the cart; instead, it acts as a key that lets you download and play the digital version of the game. You'll need at least 30GB of free space on your Switch 2 to install Monster Hunter Stories 3.

Monster Hunter Stories 3: Twisted Reflection Fanatical Discount (PC)

$57.39 (was $70) | Releases March 13, 2026

As mentioned above, Monster Hunter Stories 3 is also available to preorder digitally on PC and console. PC players can save a few dollars by purchasing their copy at Fanatical, which is discounting all preorders by nearly 20%. You can preorder the digital standard edition--which includes all the same game content a preorder bonus at the physical edition--for just $57.39 (was $70) at Fanatical. Grabbing the game at Fanatical gets you an official Steam key.

Fanatical is also discounting the Deluxe Edition to $73.79 (was $90) and the Premium Deluxe Edition to $82 (was $100). These expanded digital editions include the base game, along with additional content such as layered armor sets, bonus story missions, and more. Check out what each version includes below. Monster Hunter Stories 3 Deluxe Edition and Premium Deluxe Editions are also available to preorder digitaly on console, but only at full price.

Monster Hunter Stories 3 Deluxe Edition

  • Monster Hunter Stories 3 base game
  • Additional Side Story: Rudy
  • Special Outfits Set:
  • Royal Flair Layered Armor (Eleanor)
  • Protective Wings Layered Armor (Gaul)
  • Armored Beauty Layered Armor (Kora)
  • Eager Explorer Layered Armor (Ogden)
  • Sky Blue Coat Layered Armor (Thea)
  • Monster Hair: Arkveld Mane, Lunagaron Fade, Mizutsune Braid
  • Rudy Outfits: Regal Aspect, Smooth Sailing, Velvety Fur, Aristocratic Air
  • Skyscale Queen Layered Armor (Eleanor) | Preorder Bonus

Monster Hunter Stories 3 Premium Deluxe Edition

  • Everything from the Deluxe Edition, plus:
  • Foreign Dancer Layered Armor (Eleanor)
  • Fur-tive Five Leader Layered Armor (Gaul)
  • Attendant's Attire Layered Armor (Kora)
  • Summertime Ogden Layered Armor (Ogden)
  • Canyne Ward Layered Armor (Thea)
  • Monster Hair: Malzeno Bob, Hellfire Tail, Espinas Spikes, Garangolm Nest, Octolocks Princess, Goss Hairagy
  • Rudy Outfits: Rudy's Arkbelt, Scintillating Armor, Relaxed-acabra, Shogun Rudy, Rudyzeno
  • Skyscale Queen Layered Armor (Eleanor) | Preorder Bonus

Monster Hunter Stories 3 Amiibo

Along with the physical and digital preorders, Hunter Stories 3 is also getting three unique Switch 2 Amiibo figures. The first two are based on the twin Rathalos that the main characters ride on their adventure, and the third is a figure of the party's Palico companion, Rudy. While Nintendo has shown off all three figures, we don't yet know when they're launching or how much each will cost, and none are available for preorder yet. We'll update this section once more information is announced.

Monster Hunter Stories 3: Twisted Reflection follows an all-new story and cast of characters, making it a great jumping-on point if you haven't played the first two games in the series. However, since we're still a few months out from the game's launch, now is a great time to check out the earlier entries if you're curious. The best way to grab them is with the Monster Hunter Stories Collection, which includes Monster Hunter Stories Remastered and Monster Hunter Stories II: Wings of Ruin in one package. Physical Switch copies are available for $39 at Amazon or $45.50 Walmart, while PC players can get the double pack for $49.19 (was $60) at Fanatical. The Switch version of the game is playable on the Switch 2. Monster Hunter Stories Collection is also available digitally on PS4 and Switch.

Monster Hunter Stories 3 is a new RPG set in the world of Monster Hunter. Unlike the mainline series that's focused on repeatedly hunting the franchise's massive fauna, the Stories spinoffs are narrative-focused adventures that follow Monster Riders, a culture that lives in cooperation with the Monsters, rather than hunting them. Players capture and raise a roster of monsters, then team up with them in turn-based combat and use their special abilities to aid in exploring the vast overworld and dungeon-like monster dens. Monster Hunter Stories 3 changes up the formula with a new art style and a dual-protagonist focus, with the player's unnamed hero joining forces with Eleanor, the princess of a rival kingdom, to investigate an omen that could signal an oncoming calamity that threatens both characters' homelands. We got a chance to go hands-on with the game back in September, so be sure to check that out for more information on how the RPG is shaping up so far.

item.title: Splitgate: Arena Reloaded Will Relaunch The Halo-Meets-Portal Shooter After A Rough Year
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

After some very public missteps and an unprecedented return to beta, Splitgate is hoping to make a comeback under a new name. At the PC Games Show, 1047 Games announced that Splitgate 2 will return as Splitgate: Arena Reloaded on December 17, with massive gameplay and progression changes that aim to bring the shooter closer to its roots.

According to 1047 Games design director Josh Watson, the studio has been rebuilding the game "from the ground up," incorporating and refining the best elements from both Splitgate games while "removing what didn't work." In a video announcement, Watson specifically cited Unreal Tournament, Quake, and Halo as the main inspirations for Splitgate.

To that end, the rebooted Splitgate will lack the Factions and Abilities introduced in Splitgate 2 for a more "classic arena combat" experience. Arena Reloaded also contains retooled progression and ranked systems, along with reduced in-game store prices; Splitgate 2's microtransactions were a major pain point with players when the game first launched.

Additionally, Splitgate: Arena Unloaded adds five new maps, six "fully reworked" maps, three new Primary Weapons, and a Railgun power weapon. 1047 Games emphasizes that all the new additions are based on community feedback through public playtesting.

1047 Games announced last month that the Splitgate 2 beta ends on December 4, with the game going offline afterward before its relaunch. As with Splitgate 2, Splitgate: Arena Reloaded will be free-to-play on PC, PlayStation 4 and 5, Xbox One, and Xbox Series X|S.

Splitgate 2 first launched in open beta form in May before a full release in June. After a public controversy in which 1047 Games wore a "Make FPS Great Again" hat at Summer Game Fest, along with microtransaction complaints and developer layoffs, the game reverted back to beta in July.
